revised_title: The Influence of Age and Body Weight on Decompression Effects in Caisson Workers
tldr: This study investigates the relationship between age and body weight to decompression effects in caisson workers. The authors found that older workers and those with higher body weight were more likely to be affected by decompression sickness. They also discovered that smaller animals, such as rats, were more resistant to the effects of decompression, suggesting that body mass plays a significant role in the severity of decompression illness.
